intro: Dipetalum biloculare, commonly known as the two-celled dipetalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive, lobed shape. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature.
